channel.title: I got a compiler error and i have tryed fixing it
channel.description:
here is my error
[code] ^ Gui.java:6: class, interface, or enum expected public int midiCount; ^ Gui.java:7: class, interface, or enum expected public Sequencer sequencer; ^ Gui.java:8: class, interface, or enum expected public static void main(String args[]) ^ Gui.java:11: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:13: class, interface, or enum expected public Gui(String args[]) ^ Gui.java:16: class, interface, or enum expected try ^ Gui.java:19: class, interface, or enum expected initUI(); ^ Gui.java:20: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:24: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:28: class, interface, or enum expected public void initUI() ^ Gui.java:33: class, interface, or enum expected UIManager.setLookAndFeel("org.jvnet.substance.skin.Subst anceCremeLookAndFeel"); ^ Gui.java:34: class, interface, or enum expected JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true); ^ Gui.java:35: class, interface, or enum expected JDialog.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true); ^ Gui.java:36: class, interface, or enum expected JPopupMenu.setDefaultLightWeightPopupEnabled(false); ^ Gui.java:38: class, interface, or enum expected sign.signlink.mainapp = this; // Dangerous reference? ^ Gui.java:40: class, interface, or enum expected frame = new JFrame(frameTitle); ^ Gui.java:41: class, interface, or enum expected if((new File("java_ownz_32/icon.png")).isFile()) ^ Gui.java:43: class, interface, or enum expected frame.setLayout(new BorderLayout()); ^ Gui.java:45: class, interface, or enum expected frame.setResizable(false); ^ Gui.java:46: class, interface, or enum expected frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE); ^ Gui.java:48: class, interface, or enum expected JPanel gamePanel = new JPanel(); ^ Gui.java:49: class, interface, or enum expected gamePanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout()); ^ Gui.java:51: class, interface, or enum expected gamePanel.add(this); ^ Gui.java:52: class, interface, or enum expected gamePanel.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(765, 503)); ^ Gui.java:54: class, interface, or enum expected JMenuBar menuBar = new JMenuBar(); ^ Gui.java:56: class, interface, or enum expected JMenu fileMenu = new JMenu("File"); ^ Gui.java:57: class, interface, or enum expected JMenu musicmenu = new JMenu("Music Set"); ^ Gui.java:58: class, interface, or enum expected JMenu chatMenu = new JMenu("Censors'"); ^ Gui.java:59: class, interface, or enum expected JMenu miscMenu = new JMenu("Forums"); ^ Gui.java:60: class, interface, or enum expected JMenu toolsMenu = new JMenu("ID lists"); ^ Gui.java:61: class, interface, or enum expected JMenu ThemeMenu = new JMenu("Themes"); ^ Gui.java:62: class, interface, or enum expected JMenu serverMenu = new JMenu("Server Lists"); ^ Gui.java:63: class, interface, or enum expected JButton modelMenu = new JButton("Add Models"); ^ Gui.java:64: class, interface, or enum expected modelMenu.setActionCommand("Add Models"); ^ Gui.java:65: class, interface, or enum expected modelMenu.addActionListener(this); ^ Gui.java:66: class, interface, or enum expected JButton shotMenu = new JButton("Screenshot"); ^ Gui.java:67: class, interface, or enum expected shotMenu.setActionCommand("Screenshot"); ^ Gui.java:68: class, interface, or enum expected shotMenu.addActionListener(this); ^ Gui.java:69: class, interface, or enum expected String[] serverButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:73: class, interface, or enum expected String[] miscButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:77: class, interface, or enum expected String[] musicButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:81: class, interface, or enum expected String[] mainButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:85: class, interface, or enum expected String[] toolsButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:89: class, interface, or enum expected String[] chatButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:93: class, interface, or enum expected String[] ExtraButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:97: class, interface, or enum expected String[] miscButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:101: class, interface, or enum expected String[] ThemeButtons = new String[] ^ Gui.java:106: class, interface, or enum expected for (String name : mainButtons) ^ Gui.java:109: class, interface, or enum expected if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-")) ^ Gui.java:111: class, interface, or enum expected else ^ Gui.java:114: class, interface, or enum expected fileMenu.add(menuItem); ^ Gui.java:115: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:120: class, interface, or enum expected if (name.equalsIgnoreCas e("-")) ^ Gui.java:122: class, interface, or enum expected else ^ Gui.java:125: class, interface, or enum expected musicmenu.add(me nuItem); ^ Gui.java:126: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:131: class, interface, or enum expected if (name.equalsIgnoreCas e("-")) ^ Gui.java:133: class, interface, or enum expected else ^ Gui.java:136: class, interface, or enum expected chatMenu.add(men uItem); ^ Gui.java:137: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:142: class, interface, or enum expected if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-")) ^ Gui.java:144: class, interface, or enum expected else ^ Gui.java:147: class, interface, or enum expected miscMenu.add(menuItem); ^ Gui.java:148: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:153: class, interface, or enum expected if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-")) ^ Gui.java:155: class, interface, or enum expected else ^ Gui.java:158: class, interface, or enum expected menuItem.addActionListener(this); ^ Gui.java:159: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:164: class, interface, or enum expected if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-")) ^ Gui.java:166: class, interface, or enum expected else ^ Gui.java:169: class, interface, or enum expected menuItem.addActionListener(this); ^ Gui.java:170: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:175: class, interface, or enum expected if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("-")) ^ Gui.java:177: class, interface, or enum expected else ^ Gui.java:180: class, interface, or enum expected menuItem.addActionListener(this); ^ Gui.java:181: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:185: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(musicmenu); ^ Gui.java:186: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(chatMenu); ^ Gui.java:187: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(miscMenu); ^ Gui.java:188: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(serverMenu); ^ Gui.java:189: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(toolsMenu); ^ Gui.java:190: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(modelMenu); ^ Gui.java:191: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(shotMenu); ^ Gui.java:192: class, interface, or enum expected menuBar.add(ThemeMenu); ^ Gui.java:197: class, interface, or enum expected frame.getContentPane().add(menuBar, BorderLayout.NORTH);
^ Gui.java:198: class, interface, or enum expected frame.getContentPane().add(gamePanel, BorderLayout.CENTE R); ^ Gui.java:199: class, interface, or enum expected frame.pack(); ^ Gui.java:200: class, interface, or enum expected frame.setVisible(true); ^ Gui.java:201: class, interface, or enum expected init(); ^ Gui.java:202: class, interface, or enum expected midiPlayer("Play"); ^ Gui.java:203: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:207: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ Gui.java:209: class, interface, or enum expected public JDialog createFileChooserDialog(JFileChooser jfilechooser, Strin g s, Container container) ^ Gui.java:212: class, interface, or enum expected jdialog.setDefaultCloseOperation(2); ^ Gui.java:213: class, interface, or enum expected jdialog.add(jfilechooser); ^ Gui.java:214: class, interface, or enum expected jdialog.pack(); ^ 100 errors Compiling Finished. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
here are the codes i put in
[code]first code
String[] toolsButtons = new String[] { "Item IDs", "NPC IDs", "Object IDs", "New Item IDs", "interface" };
second code
else if (actionCommand.equals("Interface")) { try { anInt857 = Integer.parseInt(JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter interface #. (e.g. 5292)", "RS Interface", 3)); } catch (Exception e) { } }[/code]
tell me if you want my whole gui.java file

item.title: I got a compiler error and i have tryed fixing it
item.dc:creator: @Xx_Mott_xX Xx Mott xX
item.description:
@Xx_Mott_xX wrote:

theres an “interface” and an “Interface”, they gotta have same lowercase+uppercase so there same.

Read full topic
item.source: I got a compiler error and i have tryed fixing it

item.title: I got a compiler error and i have tryed fixing it
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“hayden190732, post:2, topic:267310”]Why dont you try this:

@echo off color 0b title [Name of compiler] @echo ---------------------- @echo --Initiating Compile-- @echo ---------------------- "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java @echo ---------------------- @echo --Compiling complete-- @echo ---------------------- @echo off title [Name of compiler] "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m server

Where it says:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe

Enter your destination, of where your java is.[/quote]

Sorry, but this is incorrect.

You must have too many braces ({}) somewhere. Make sure that there are not too many }'s somewhere. Remember, that for every { there must be a }.

Read full topic
item.source: I got a compiler error and i have tryed fixing it

item.title: I got a compiler error and i have tryed fixing it
item.dc:creator: @hayden190732 hayden190732
item.description:
@hayden190732 wrote:

Why dont you try this:

@echo off color 0b title [Name of compiler] @echo ---------------------- @echo --Initiating Compile-- @echo ---------------------- "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java @echo ---------------------- @echo --Compiling complete-- @echo ---------------------- @echo off title [Name of compiler] "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m server

Where it says:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe

Enter your destination, of where your java is.

Read full topic
